hints.content:
We can think of division as the following:

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\blueD{\text{ Number of Groups}}$

or 

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\maroonD{\text{ Size of the Groups}}$

We have a $\greenD{\text{total}}$ of $\greenD{24}$ acorns.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ of acorns is $\maroonD8$.  

Which image shows $\greenD{24}$ acorns divided evenly into groups of $\maroonD8$?

This image represents the situation:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Three groups of 8 acorns. Each group of acorns has a circle around it. !

question.content:
Marlo has $24$ acorns. He puts them into groups of $8$ acorns. 

**Which image could represent this situation?**


[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![Two groups of 8 acorns. Each group of acorns has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6e605b965ff3cad65cddc7f8e897b7751ca56f94)
![Three groups of 8 acorns. Each group of acorns has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/92f25a334f0be5522458928d8ccc498607c290e0)
![Eight groups of 2 acorns. Each group of acorns has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f11d169db208c8a21df0b492baa6980329af50fe)
